page.title: 20SOCIAL CONCERNS
page.content: {MARSH FARM SOCIAL ATTITUDES SURVEY} A survey was taken into what people, who lived in and outside the area,though the urban areas of the services and facilities in Marsh Farm and Sundon Park. Many felt that the services were inadequate and did little to help newcomers settle in. Many felt that the bus routes into further estates were virtually inadequate. Others thought that the post office bank wasn't enough and would have liked a branch of a national bank nearer than Leagrave,a district further into Luton. Other amenities people would have liked to see in the area included: a police station, better play areas and a wider range of shops. The area did contain a number of youth clubs, libraries,and other recreational centres.
